description: Borrowed from French hérésiarque, from Ecclesiastical Latin haeresiarcha (or directly from the Latin word), from ecclesiastical Byzantine Greek αἱρεσιάρχης (hairesiárkhēs, “leader of a sect”), from Ancient Greek αἵρεσῐς (haíresis, “heresy”) + -ᾰ́ρχης (-árkhēs, “suffix meaning ‘leader, ruler’”), corresponding to heresy +‎ -arch.

entries.meaning: (religion) The founder of a heresy, or a major ecclesiastical proponent of such a heresy. [from mid 16th c.]
